question: Question_03_(a)
statement:
\textbf{Full-Solution Problem.} Justify your answer and \textbf{show all
your work.} Simplification of your answer is not required.

Evaluate the following integral

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
\int \frac{4x + 4}{x(x+1)^{2}} \, dx.\end{align*}
hints:
Can you rewrite the integrand in a way that will allow you to compute
the integral?
